summary: This document is an electronic communication from the FBI requesting assistance from the Document Conversion Laboratory for scanning and automation of telephone records related to an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez, who was the former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein. The document outlines the procedures for handling and processing the records, emphasizing the importance of the information contained within them, particularly regarding potential underage victims.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Rodriguez is the subject of an obstruction of justice case and was in possession of an address book containing names and phone numbers of potential underage victims of Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the subject of a child prostitution case and is connected to the investigation through the address book that Rodriguez possessed.

connections.description: Rodriguez was employed as the house manager and butler for Epstein.

events.title: Obstruction of Justice Case Opened
events.description: The Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez attempted to sell an address book containing names and phone numbers of potential underage victims instead of turning it over to law enforcement.
The address book is believed to contain information about additional underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez was the former house manager and butler for Epstein.
The document outlines procedures for scanning and processing telephone records related to the investigation.
The investigation is part of a broader inquiry into Epstein's activities and potential victims.
